lead_paragraph: Diego Corrales, robbed of a big payday a year ago when his last opponent could not make weight, was five pounds over the weight limit for tonight’s scheduled defense of his World Boxing Council lightweight (135 pounds) title against Joel Casamayor in Las Vegas. Corrales lost his title, but he agreed to give up some of his $1.2 million purse to Casamayor so the fight would go on. Casamayor will win the title if he defeats Corrales, who cannot get back the title tonight.
